intro: Struthanthus eichlerianus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
